summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from October 2020 discussing logistical coordination for sending meeting invitations and RSVP questionnaires to victims and their attorneys in the Epstein case. The emails involve personnel from the FBI's Victim Services Division, the Department of Justice's Civil Rights Division (CRT), and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG), focusing on outreach to victims and their legal representatives for a meeting scheduled for November 12, 2020.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Mentioned as the source providing a list of clients (victims) to the FBI team.

persons.name: Bob Josefverg
persons.context: Mentioned as the person from whom the Victim Specialist is obtaining the most recent list of clients.

connections.description: Brittany Henderson, a Victim Specialist, is obtaining a client list from Bob Josefverg.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Meeting
events.description: A meeting for which invitations and RSVP questionnaires are being prepared and sent to victims and their attorneys.

keyFacts: The document is an internal FBI email chain coordinating victim outreach for a meeting related to the Epstein case.
Invitations were sent to 14 attorneys (to pass on to clients), 6 victims directly, and a family member of a deceased victim.
A master list of victims existed, but direct contact information was lacking for many, and some victims had multiple attorneys.
The correspondence highlights the logistical challenges and procedural care (e.g., document clearance, confidentiality) involved in communicating with Epstein case victims.
